tossed up on the stumps, driven to mid-off
big stride forward to defend, the ball rolls away off a thick inside edge
goes for it and just over long-on went down on one knee to slog-sweep it. got the elevation but not the distance. Long-on was standing inside the ropes, just cleared him and went into the boundary
good length on the stumps, comes forward to defend with bat and pad close together
committed to the front foot early but the ball was pitched up and he defends it easily enough in the end
comes well forward to defend.
comes down the track and drives it straight back to the bowler
well tossed up outside off, driven with a free-flowing bat to extra cover
flatter and shorter, Hetmyer is onto it in a flash. Rocks back and cuts it through point. Went deep inside his crease there
and now he steps out and hits it inside out, over long-off for six. Hit it well enough to sail over the fence, despite not timing it perfectly
he's been forced to change tack and go over the wicket, and immediately draws the edge, spinning it away from the left-hander. Hetmyer came forward to defend, the ball rolled to slip off the edge
floated up on the stumps and driven to long-on. Fifty-run stand
slightly short, he goes on the back foot and chops it away to point
floated up, he comes forward to defend
swept fine. Got the placement right, if not the execution. Went down to sweep, got a bit of a top edge ,but the ball landed safely and went to fine leg
too short, getting some turn but he's able to comfortably pat it away to mid-on
punched to long-on
on target, on the stumps, defended off the front foot
too short, allows him to slap it through cover
too short again, he goes back and pulls to deep midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, he makes room and drives to cover
length ball on the stumps, spinning away, punched to mid-off
a touch short again, and he goes on the back foot and hits with the turn through cover
way too short and straying down leg, easily pulled to the deep square leg fence
better length, brings him forward to defend
tossed up outside off, driven through extra cover
back of a length on the stumps, he goes deep inside his crease again and cuts it to the left of point
nice length, tossed up and dipping, but he comes forward and gets to the pitch of the ball to defend

Oh that's gone through. And five penalty runs because it's hit the helmet that was behind the keeper. It beat the batsman's drive and flipped the pad. Mushfiqur was too busy appeal to collect the ball, and it hits the helmet that's behind him.
too short again and spinning down leg, he gets some glove on that and sends it very fine
patted back to the bowler
tossed up but drifting on the pads, easily tapped to midwicket for a single

too short again, and Hetmyer rocks back to pull powerfully to midwicket. Fifty for Hetmyer off just 43 balls. Fine counter-attacking innings that's revived West Indies somewhat after the early collapse
just clears mid-off tossed up and he went for the drive, didn't get hold of it. Mid-on went airborne to his left. Maybe the ball brushed his fingertips. Doesn't alter it's course and it's a boundary

nothing half-hearted about that! Steps out and absolutely smashes it over long-on. He's not allowed the last ball to play on his mind, and that is why he's made the runs he has - it's been a feature all innings long
defended off the front foot
mis-judged that! stayed back and the ball popped off the outside edge of the bat, but there was no fielder at silly mid-on
very full and driven gently to extra cover
a touch short but he doesn't connect well with that back foot pull that has served him well. Only gets it as far as short midwicket
given air on the stumps, he comes forward and defends
on a length spinning into him, he turns it to short fine leg
smashed Comes down the track and meets the ball perfectly, sends it straight and true, over long-on. Dowrich doing a Hetmyer
fuller ball, pushed to midwicket
too short, allows him to stay back and cut past backward point for a couple

beautifully bowled That had flight, dip, turn - everything a spinner wants. Drew him forward, landed perfectly and spun just enough to take his outside edge and nestle into the keeper's gloves. The end of a fine innings.

too short outside off, allows him to transfer weight back and punch towards cover, but the ball pings off the ankle of the man at silly point. Painful blow for Imrul Kayes, and he's limping off the field now with his shoe off.
too short again, steered to point off by opening the bat face
more full, defended off the front foot
very full, comes forward to drive to point's right
tried to drive that but it goes off the inside edge onto pad
sweeps hard but straight to square leg
too short on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
too short, punched back to the bowler
driven to mid-off
full and wide outside off, he gets down on one knee to slap it to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward to defend to the leg side
stays back to this length ball and defends from the crease
too short, on the pads, turned to fine leg
good length on the stumps, forces him to present a straight bat in defence
another good ball. Spits up off a length and turns sharply past the batsman. Was pitched on off, and he half came forward to defend but had to drop his gloves and let the ball whizz through
tossed up on the stumps, steered to point and they take a quick single
good length, brought him forward but dipped on him, the ball goes inthe air off the inside edge, but just eludes the fielder at short leg
stays back to this, though it's fuller and turns it to short fine leg off his pads
steps down the track and gets to the pitch of the ball, pushes it back to the bowler
gets him to take a big stride out to defend, but the ball bounced a bit and took the top of the bat
a touch too full, and driven to long-off
too short, he goes back and tries to flick it with the spin, but the ball can't go further than the man at short leg, bounces off him. Wasn't hit hard though, so no damage. And that will be tea
length ball sliding outside off, beaten on the late cut
full on leg stump, swept to long leg's right
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover off the back foot
full on leg stump, swept to deep square
full on off stump, defended to point off the outside half
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, swept along the floor to deep square
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
inside edge past short leg. Length at middle stump, looks to defend and is done by the extra bounce. Too quick for short leg to his right
shot. Won't let this bounce and turn. Down the track to meet it at the pitch and he drills it flat over the bowler
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball dipping on off stump and climbing past the outside edge as Bishoo comes down late on the forward press
full on middle stump, gets low and sweeps to deep square leg's right

caught in front! Bishoo has been sweeping adventurously and it'll cost him this time. Length ball skids on and hits him in on the back thigh in front of middle stump, He was through the shot with the front leg outside leg stump
massive turn to beat everyone. Short of a length outside off from over the wicket, Roach shapes to punch through cover but this cuts through him and climbs over the stumps before beating Rahim
full and wide outside off, driven to long-off's left

lbw decision reviewed by Roach. Caught on the back foot against a ball spinning big and into him. He was looking to defend, but that was a long way past the inside edge. However, he is right in front middle and very deep in the crease. This is hitting leg stump. West Indies are out of reviews. Roach is gone and Nayeem is one wicket away from a debut five-for
full on off stump, driven towards long-off off the toe end of the bat
length ball turning in sharply to leg stump. Hurriedly poked to square leg on the up
short of a length and climbing up at the hips. Goes on the back foot and fends at it. Off the glove, into the thigh and lands safely between short leg and leg slip
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on the pads, pings off the pad to short leg
full outside off, thick outside edge rolls past slip as he looks to defend on the front foot
full outside off, steps out and drives with the turn to long-on
short and cutting in at off stump. Backs away and slices it through the open point region
length, wide outside off. Jabs hard at it and it flies past short leg off the thick inside edge
length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket's right off the back foot
length and spinning in at leg stump. Backs away and nudges it through cover
length ball pushed down leg side, beaten on the flick
dropped at short leg. Length ball at leg stump, swishes at it and gets a thick inside edge that flies towards the helmet and he can't react quickly enough
length outside off, pushed to cover on the up
short and just outside off. Backs away and chops it through point
length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short on middle stump, gets back and whips it to deep midwicket
length on middle stump, blocked off the inside half
length on off, defended off the inside half
short of a length down leg side, gets deep in the crease and deflects it fine off the thigh
length on off, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to backward square leg
length on off stump, tapped into the off side
full outside off, driven to extra cover against the turn
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover's left off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, beaten on the forward defence. That gets big on Rahim too, he collects at chest height after some assistance from helmet grille. Not out on the catch behind appeal
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, flicked back to the bowler
length ball on leg stump, spins down leg as he leaves
short of a length outside off, chopped through the open point region
short and down leg side. Looks to pull. It comes off his pad and Rahim collects
length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he presses forward. Once again, that gets big on the keeper
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off, blocked into the covers
full on off stump, squeezed into the covers off the outside half of the bat
length outside off, thick outside edge past slip that runs to backward point's left
length at off stump, dead-batted into the off side
full outside off, driven to deep mid-off

through the defence and that's a five-for on debut for 17-year-old Nayeem Hasan. What a match he's having. Length ball dips rapidly outside off, lands on a length and zips past the inside edge of the angled bat to hit top of middle and off.
length on leg stump, spinning  in sharply and past his inside edge. Lobs up to short leg off the pad
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
short and wide outside off, gets on the back foot and clatters it straight to sweeper cover
full on off stump, leans in and goes inside-out over extra over to come back for the second. Another fighting fifty from Dowrich
yorker length at leg stump. Looks to drive through off, gets an inside edge past keeper
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he looks to defend
nicely done. Full outside off, gets low and whips under this with a reverse sweep. No one back there at third man
smoked it! Huge from Dowrich. Length ball on middle stump, gets down and gets the front leg into the leg side to make room before slaughtering this with a slog sweep
length and in at off stump, defended into the pitch off the back foot
length ball pushed through flat at middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
length at off stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
length at middle stump, gets on the back foot and punches to deep midwicket's left
length on off stump, punched back down the pitch
swipes it way over wide long-on! Can't say he's known to be a defensive batsman when he has a frontline batsman as partner. Tossed up outside off, big stride, big slog
length outside off, defended into the covers

taken at slip. Dowrich took the gamble, it hasn't worked. To add to the statement after the six, Gabriel isn't known for playing out the last ball of an over either. Jabs at this on the front foot, it spins away, and it is straightforwad for Mahmudullah
back of a length outside off, and punched through cover point straight away for runs
too full on the stumps, and driven back past the bowler with the full face of the bat
airy waft, and he's beaten. Got the length better that time and kept it in the corridor. Careless shot, but he's not made contact so he survives.
punched off the back foot to cover
beautiful shot leans into the straight drive and sends it purring to the long-on fence. The ball was too full and there to be hit, and he did it pleasingly
expensive first over, very loose from Roach. Soumya pulls this short ball to deep midwicket for another boundary.
on a good length on the stumps, defended carefully
too full and straying on the pads, he's picked him off to deep midwicket with a nicely timed flick
too full again, and he comes on the front foot to drive to long-on
better length, driven but without conviction and the bowler runs across to stop stop it with his foot
cleaned him up! nicely tossed up outside off, and turns appreciably to go through the big gap between pad and the airy waft of the bat. Shatters timber. West Indies are not out of this yet.
back of a length outside off, spinning back into the batsman. Punched off a thick inside edge back to the bowler
good length outside off, he comes forward and pushes it to cover
comes forward and defends
defended off the front foot

juggled and caught in the slips but the umpires are checking to make sure. Went for the drive without moving his feet and got an outside edge. It flew quickly to first slip and the ball popped out, but he managed to grab it on second try

given lbw first ball and immediate review Flighted ball on the stumps, and he simply padded it away. Appeal and the umpire has raised his finger. Might have to go on umpire's call. In fact, it's bouncing over the stumps so he'll be saved. They are checking to see if the ball brushed glove too, and it didn't. Mithun survives
good length, given some air outside off, and it hits the pad and flies off to short fine leg. He had stretched well out and was hit outside the line that time though, so no appeal
on a length, turning away from the batsman, he stays in his crease and pats it back
comes forward to drive this to cover
back of a length, stays in his crease and punches to cover. Not much foot movement from the batsman
goes too full and ends up as a half volley, and he has no trouble putting that away to the cover fence with a flowing cover drive
gets the length better that time and the batsman defends carefully
tossed up on off, and defended with a stride forward. Thickish edge rolls to slip
risky driven uppishly through point, evades the man there to go to the fence
just dropped short good bowling this looping and drawing him forward and turning to take the edge. It fell centimetres short of the slip fielder
comes down the track and the bowler shortens his length but he's in good enough position to push it through cover with good timing
short and turned to square leg
steered to gully with an open face

comes forward and is hit on the pads. they're reviewing this He might have come too far forward, though. The bat was very close to the pad, and the ball could have brushed the inside edge of the bat too. No it hasn't. Ah well, it is hitting the stumps, but he was more than 3 metres in front so that stays with the on-field umpire's call.
good length and fizzing away from the batsman, he defends to point from his crease
keeps it on that length, on off stump that time. Defended to point again
a bit fuller, and he comes forward to push it to cover
drags it down a bit short but Mominul is unable to take advantage. Pushes it tamely to mid-off
tossed up and the batsman misses the flick. Got an inside edge onto pad though - would have been lbw if not.
too full again, but he can't connect with the flick, it comes off the toe end
better length but strays in line and he's able to flick it off his hips to square leg
overpitched, and Mominul picks it up on the half-volley and lifts it over the in-field. Bounces just in front of the midwicket rope and the man running from square leg can't stop it
length outside off, he lets it go through

drifts on the pads and given lbw. It was the drift and subsequent straightening that beat him, he was moving across to tuck it, but the ball pitches in line with leg and straightens enough to hit him. Mominul was back in his crease and after a short discussion with Mithun, opts not to review.
stays back to this length ball on off and pushes it to point
too short and straying on the pads, picked off to deep square leg
tossed up on the stumps, defended off the front foot
tossed up on off that time, he stays back and gets low to carve it past point

picks out deep midwicket with a slog-sweep! That is a terrible shot by Shakib. Tossed up on off, a bit full, Shakib went for the sweep. Connected well, but there was a man back there whom he picked out almost with a pin point. Poor, poor shot from one of the most experienced batsmen in the side, and Bangladesh are in a bit of a hole now, despite that first-innings lead
oooh, that went close to the off stump. Went with the angle from round the wicket and Mushfiqur opted to let it go through. Not the safest move perhaps
tossed up on the stumps, but turning into the batsman's pads and he's able to go back and clip it to deep square leg
drags it short and down leg, defeats the batsman's attempted sweep
good length on off and spinning into the batsman, he stays inside the line and punches to point
too full and he comes forward to flick it, but the ball taps into one of the men close in
reverse sweep executes it well though doesn't get the timing on it to send it racing. It's pulled in before it can reach the third man fence
tossed up, he comes down the track and drives to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, he had stretched forward almost before the ball reached him. Smothers it
steered to point with soft hands off the front foot
good length on the stumps, spinning away from the batsman. He stays beside the line and punches towards gully
beaten perfect ball, making a pleasing arc on the way to the batsman, drawing him forward, pitching in front and hissing away
connects with the sweep. A bit too full and he's quickly on to it, paddle-sweeps it to fine leg.
tossed up on the stumps, the correct length to draw him forward. He defends
tossed up again, a bit fuller, allowing him to pick it up from outside off and flick it to deep midwicket
tossed up but on leg, Mushfiqur stays put and lets the ball hit his back thigh
pushed to point
tossed up, he takes a big stride forward and drops the ball dead
good ball to finish, tossed up again but on that uncertain length. He chooses to stay back and only just manages to get the bat down in time to defend it.
flatter on off, he stays back and cuts, but straight to point
given some room outside off and he manages to free his arms and slash it down to a square third man
coming in with the angle but outside off. He was sure where his off stump was, so was confident in letting it go through
full on the stumps, big stride forward and defended
tossed up a bit more but on the same length. Defended with a big stride forward again
too full and he paddles it fine
flighted on off, spins past the attempted cut
too full, which allows the sweep to come into play. Deep square leg collects
short, but not short enough to cut. Mithun shapes for it but the ball skids through
tossed up on off, spinning further away which allows him to slap it to deep point off the back foot
full again, driven to long-off with a straight bat
full and drifting into the batsman, driven back to the bowler
stays back to this length ball and punches to cover
delicately steered to short third man's left
full on the stumps, he takes a big stride forward and drives to long-off
tossed up, drifting on the pads, but he can't tuck it away
gets the line right, on middle stump and turns sharply away from the batsman
pushed down to long-on
length ball on middle, turns sharply, defended from the crease
beats him with turn, drifts and turns past the defensive prod, but the edge flies well away from silly point
ooh good bowling, that is quicker and traps him on the crease almost, but the bat comes down in time to keep the ball out

he's got him! went back to a length ball, didn't seem to have a clue where it was pitching. Takes his pad flap and crashes into the stumps. Valuable mini-stand for Bangladesh, but Bishoo's strike has rendered balance back to the match
just past forward short leg off the inside edge got this to turn and take the glove. Mushfiqur played it with soft hands though and it didn't fly off. went to the fielder's right

beautiful ball, completely beats Mehidy. They've gone for the review. I'm not sure for what. Perhaps for caught behind. Or could be for lbw. It has just brushed the pad, though it's not taken any bat. Oh he's saved by a whisker! By a whisker. It struck him in line, had pitched in line - but umpire's call on impact. Even though an appreciable part of the ball is hitting the stumps.
tossed up on leg, he steps out and drives to mid-on
beaten again. Big turn fizzes past his bat
on off and big turn again, but Mushfiqur is equal to the task and plays it with the turn to point
drags it down a bit and he rocks back to slap it through cover for a single
whizzes past. ripping leg break that leaves the batsman unsure, stuck on the crease, and goes past a prodding bat
comes well forward to defend
another confident stride out to smother the ball
well negotiated, pitched on leg and hurried through, but he defends from the crease. That will be stumps
given some air, but too full. Driven gently to cover
good length, getting Mushfiqur to stretch forward to defend the ball and drop it at his feet
tossed up and too full, Mushfiqur goes down on one knee to sweep confidently, sends the ball crashing to the square leg fence
gets the length better that time, getting Mushfiqur to come forward in defence
swept again, but didn't get hold of it as well as he had the previous one. Got a top edge that landed just clear of midwicket, who tried to tumble and dive for the catch but the ball was out of reach
reverse sweep goes wrong, but he survives What is Mushfiqur doing? High risk shot, went for the reverse sweep, the ball took his glove and went down to fine leg
short and wide outside off, gently slapped past point
edged past slip in the corridor, hint of a movement back into him, he hung his bat out, and Gabriel drew the outside edge. But it flew just wide of the lone slip
back of a length and coming into him again, defended solidly
back of a length outside off, that hardly bounces. He steers it comfortably to deep point
well directed bouncer but he's overstepped. And by a fair bit Rose up from the middle of the pitch and had Mushfiqur playing it down from near his throat, but he'll have to rebowl that

huge strike, unplayable ball short of a length, comes back in sharply to Mushfiqur. Perhaps he was expecting it to rise as much as the previous ball did, but this stays stump high, homes in between the bat and pad and hits the top of off. West Indies will fancy their chances now
back of a length outside off again, he just pushed it, but with great timing and the ball races past the in-field through cover
big turn Drifts in and pitches on that uncertain spot, he doesn't get to the pitch of it, and it whizzes past
tossed up again but fuller, and he drives nicely through cover
nicely tossed up on the stumps, but he comes forward to gently nudge it into the leg side and they take a quick single
pitched up and driven back to the bowler's left
spins past the bat again. Slightly held back, and he comes forward but the ball dips and beats bat
goes for the sweep, but doesn't connect with the ball, which hits him on the upper arm
beaten In the channel outside off, he pushed at it, and didn't connect. No feet movement
another airy waft outside off, and beaten again outside off
strays on the pads that time and Mahmudullah is beaten on the flick. Gabriel goes up in half appeal, but the ball hadn't straightened enough and would have gone down leg
outside off and pushed to deep cover
another bouncer, another no-ball Overstepped again. Short ball outside off, rose to more than chest high, Mehidy punched it above cover
back of a length and coming into the batsman, he guides it to point for a quick single
length ball outside off, defended solidly to point
given some air, on a length outside off, he drives to cover's left
beaten - this is happening frequently and will continue to do so whenever a ball hits that spot that is just out of the reach of a forward defensive. Nicely looped and spins past the bat
too full and clipped off his toes to wide long-on
stays back to that one, and steers it past point by going deep inside his crease
tossed up on the stumps, he comes nicely forward and drives to long-off
short ball again, on target, and rising up to the batsman's chest, but he swivels and pulls it well to deep square leg
another no-ball Ooh that's very tight, his heel was on the line but maybe he had a smidgeon behind it. It was a short ball and Mahmudullah ducked under it, but it didn't bounce as much as expected
back of a length on off, punched back
given some room outside off, he goes for the drive despite two slips but nails it beautifully. Opens the face to send it racing to the third man fence
back of a length on off and confidently steered to deep point
pitched that one up, and perhaps he was surprised by this yorker outside off. Late in getting the bat down and ball goes through to the keeper.
back of a length and coming back in again, takes the inside edge of his bat and flies down to the fine leg boundary. Lucky for the batsman
past the outside edge with big spin again
ooh that went with the angle. Takes a thick inside edge and rolls away off his hurried jab
went for an almost premeditated sweep, but it goes once bounce to short fine leg
beaten again, spinning past the bat off a good length
stays back to that one and pushes it towards point staying beside the line of the ball
stays back again, but the ball grips and spins past the attempted push
good length, on off and drawing him forward. Guided to gully
sharp spin, gets some drift that makes it pitch on leg and spinning past the outside edge. He manages to get some bat on it, and soft hands ensure the edge bounces and goes to slip
paddled to short fine leg
premeditated sweep, went down on one knee and waited for the spinning leg-break to come to him and hit it aerial but safe towards fine leg
beaten on the sweep Bishoo gets the ball to dip and turn, wasn't quite the length for the sweep, and the batsman is lucky it doesn't do any damage
a touch full, and he cleared his front leg to heave that one over midwicket for four
comes forward and steers it to point off an open face
holds this back a bit, allowing it to pitch and turn past the batsman. He stays inside the line
tossed up on the stumps, defended off the front foot.
dances down the track to get to the pitch of the ball and defend it
stays in his crease and negotiates this safely, watching the ball and the spin like a hawk before defending into the off side
drifts down leg and he's able to easily tuck it away behind square
loop, dip and turn. The batsman stayed back to that, should have come forward. Beaten
dropped Similar ball and he gets the edge. The ball flies to Shai Hope at chest high, and he clutches at it, and sees the ball pop out. Big moment
comes forward and clips this to square leg
comes down the track again and tucks it to wide long-on
nicely tossed up on the stump, just as nicely defended with a nice big stride out front
down the track, and gets to the pitch of the ball to clip it to deep midwicket
strays too far down leg, goes past the batsman and past the keeper for byes
tossed up on a good length on the stumps, comes forward to defend
slightly back of a length, spinning across the batsman who hangs back and pushes it towards point
stays back again to this length ball on off, cuts it to point
fuller, again outside off, pushed to cover point

beauty! perfect leggie's dismissal. Looped up and dips, the batsman's stretched forward but can't get to the pitch of the ball, which grips the surface and turns just enough to go off the shoulder of the bat and into the keeper's gloves. Mehidy's resistance ends but it's been a good hand
nicely tossed up again, but he presents a full face to defend it
pitches on off and turning away, he lets it go through
tossed up on off, could have been the googly. Defended from the crease
tossed up again, but too full, driven back and the bowler tumbles to his left to field
spinning across the batsman, but a bit short of a length which allows him to punch into cover off the back foot
comes down the track to defend this back to the bowler
back of a length, he stays in his crease and pushes it to mid-off
tossed up and drawing him forward, but he defends solidly
similar ball, same result. Defended off the front foot
spins past the bat again. He stays back in his crease for that, and it goes past
pushed to point.
nice, teasing legbreak on a fullish length outside off. Mahmudullah ignores the bait
ooh, quicker and closer to off stump - straightens just enough to miss off stump, in fact, after the ball sneaks under Mahmudullah's attempted sweep
shorter, goes on the back foot to punch to deep point
ooh, nice flight from Bishoo. Reaches in front of his body for the checked drive, and pops it uppishly past the right shoulder of silly point
fuller and straighter, pushed down the ground towards mid-on
down the track and that's a super hit. Jumped away from the line of this leg-stump delivery to loft this back over the bowler's head, high and handsome
flat, speared in towards middle stump. Goes back and across to nurdle through square leg
full, angling into the pads, clipped gently to the left of backward square leg
down the track and Warrican shortens his length a little. Stretches out to block it back to the bowler
sharp turn there. Flat, on a good length just outside off. Goes on the back foot - playing the trajectory rather than the length, and does well not to follow the ball away from his body
and again, turn and bounce, past the outside edge as he jabs at this in defence
slower, flighted, on middle stump. Stretches out to defend and it rolls off the inside edge into the short fine leg region - didn't turn as much as Nayeem expected
down the track and he isn't quite to the pitch of it. Stretches out to defend it back where it came from
not short enough to cut. Makes a lot of room and it stays a little low. Just about manages to chop it down and keep it out of his stumps
back of a length on off stump, makes room again to jab it towards deep point
flighted legbreak outside off stump, left alone
flighted again, fuller this time, drives to the man at extra-cover without quite timing it
googly, spins in from a good length fairly wide of off stump. Nayeem keeps it out with a flat-batted half-drive/half-forward defensive
full outside off, clipped with the turn to long-on
a long way down the track but he's not quite to the pitch of the ball. Long final stride to defend with the turn to midwicket
stays on the back foot and is cramped by this one, which rips in sharply from outside off. Jams it down into the leg side
more flight now, stretches out to block it back towards Chase
dips onto a nice length close to off stump, defended towards short leg off the inside half of the bat
down the pitch, possibly gets too close to the pitch to drive it off the meat of the bat. Squeezes it back to the bowler off the bottom of the bat
flat legbreak pitching on off and middle. Makes a lot of room to slap it to deep point and move the lead to 200

gone, classic legspinner's dismissal. Flighted nicely outside off, inviting the drive. Doesn't get a proper stride out to the ball, and he isn't quite close enough to the pitch of the ball. Sharp turn to get the edge, and Hope takes a straightforward catch at slip, at around knee height
floats this across into a fifth-stump line. Taijul looks for the push into the point region and gets a thick outside edge that rolls behind square - didn't turn as much as he expected it to

Mahmudullah pays the price for premeditation here. Fourth wicket for Bishoo. Shaped to sweep even before the bowler released, and Bishoo shortened his length accordingly, while also flattening his trajectory. Mahmudullah ends up playing a half-hearted attempted lap-sweep, and only manages a top-edge that balloons to slip
bam, Mustafizur begins with a meaty slog-sweep against a length ball outside off. Hits it with the turn, and it bounces down to the right of the man at deep midwicket

now Taijul goes for the big sweep from outside off. Hits the inside half of his bat and he ends up dragging it squarer than he intended. I think it hit the square-leg fielder somewhere on his body, causing the cameraperson to lose track of the ball. Yikes, straight into Ambris's chest
tight off-stump line, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
dropped. Slows it up and Mustafizur goes for the big leg-side slog. Top-edges it high towards the backtracking backward point fielder, Brathwaite, who puts down the two-hander
full outside off, driven to extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, Taijul goes for the reverse-pull/sweep and fails to connect

and that is that. West Indies will need 204 to win. Steps out and gets nowhere near the pitch of the ball. Goes through with the big heave nonetheless, and the ball grabs the outside half of his bat and ends up in long-on's grateful hands
tossed up full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
length ball sliding on with the angle towards off stump. Presses forward, watches it, and defends with soft hands
a bit fuller, good stretch out to block it back towards the bowler
nice length just outside off. Brathwaite defends with soft hands towards point
good length once more, the line just outside off. A bit more bounce and Brathwaite gets on the front foot, lets it come to him, and defends close to his body towards point
straighter now, on middle stump, worked away through backward square leg from the crease
sharp turn from outside off as Brathwaite comes forward to defend. Beats the outside edge and goes towards leg gully off the outside of his front pad
goes back and across to defend this one pitching outside off, and the ball spins past leg stump
action replay of the previous ball - Nayeem may want to shift his line wider
and again, rips past leg stump. Brathwaite doesn't offer a shot this time
fullish on middle and leg, stays back to clip watchfully into the leg side
down the track now, gets close to the pitch and clips it wide of mid-on
floated up slow and wide of off stump, drives with a lot of bottom hand to mid-off
a touch shorter, slides into the pads, clipped into the fine-leg region
full on middle stump, whipped to deep square leg

and he strikes immediately. Throws away his wicket and gifts Shakib his 200th in Tests. Down the track to a teasingly flighted ball wide of off stump, and slogs, looking for turn and looking to go over mid-on. It doesn't turn, however, and it slips past the outside edge to offer Mushfiqur the simplest of stumpings
nice flight, dips onto a good length and slides on with the angle. Defended back towards the bowler
another armer. Gets on the front foot and defends it back to the bowler. Pushed a little hard at this one
flat offbreak on an off-stump line. Goes back and across to defend
straighter now, tucked away with the turn to long leg
again on leg stump, goes back to work it to the left of backward square leg
flighted and full on middle stump, whipped down the ground to long-on
nice quick feet to get close to the pitch of this flighted off-stump ball. Clipped to midwicket
tossed up again, straighter in line, clipped to the left of square leg
flat, a touch short outside off. Rocks back and slaps it to cover point
fullish, close to off stump, defended into the off side
a touch too full to trouble Brathwaite, angling into off stump from wide of the crease. Blocked back down the pitch
drifts down leg and Brathwaite gets on the front foot to nudge into the backward square leg region

big appeal, and it's given! Hope stretched forward to defend but it was flat and the length was just perfect, outside off, which meant he didn't get close enough to the pitch of it. Tries to tuck his bat behind his pad and leave it, but the ball doesn't turn as much as expected, and it bounces a touch more to brush his glove through to the keeper
inviting flight wide of off stump. Reaches out with his hands to drive without getting a stride in, and pops it in the air, but out of reach of short cover

gone! Taijul strikes first ball with the deadliest of arm balls. Not much Brathwaite could have done about that, though he could have played forward rather than gone back to it. The trajectory was flat, however, and it just skidded through quickly before Brathwaite could bring his bat down to keep it out. Hits him on the back pad, and the umpire has no hesitation in giving him out. They're checking if Taijul overstepped, however... He's fine, just about. Landed on his toe with his heel in the air, juuuust behind the line
length ball just outside off, uses his reach to defend towards silly point
flat, back of a length, sharp turn and bounce from leg to off. Goes back and gets on top of it to keep it down
back of a length again, this one rips away even more sharply, from an off-stump line, and Chase can't get his bat anywhere near it

Taijul is on fire here! Another arm ball, another batsman playing back, another ball skidding through and striking back pad. Chase has reviewed this, but it looked out on first glance. The line began straighter than the Brathwaite delivery, and it struck him in front of middle and leg. Hitting a good chunk of leg stump, says ball-tracking
keeps it flatter and drags it down a bit short, Hetmyer flat-bats it to long-on
floats it up just around off, he defends by coming forward

slightly short and Hetmyer has decided that attack is the best form of defence - just like in the first innings. Rocks back and hits it over the bowler's head with a horizontal bat. Mahmudullah ran in from long-on and dived, but couldn't stop the boundary
cracking shot Picked it up beautifully and smashed it straight back past the bowler
bye bye ball Hetmyer has more than doubled West Indies score in three balls. Tossed up and he launches into it, lifts it high and handsome over long-on
stays back and punches this through cover. They get two easily, and Hetmyer wants the third but is sent back from almost halfway down the pitch.
clipped to long-on, coming forward. Hetmyer has scored 18 runs - West Indies had only 11 with four wickets down!
nice length, defended into the off side
stays back in his crease, and ensures he can punch this to deep cover, taking advantage of hte slightly short length
half step forward and turns it from off stump to short fine leg
gets this to drift, it ends up on leg stump and Hetmyer defends solidly
drags this down too short, and Hetmyer goes for a full blooded pull, but straight to the deep midwicket. He's not happy, he reckons that should have gone for six
third umpire called on for a potential run out chance But Hetmyer is safe. Ambris had tucked this to square leg, and called him through. Good fielding but Hetmyer made it.
drifts too far down leg and spinning further away. Left alone by the batsman
too full, and he plays it with the turn to nudge it to midwicket
slightly short and room outside off, which allows him to stroke it down to deep point with a horizontal bat
quicker and flatter, he was almost caught on the crease but brings his bat down in time to defend
steps down the track to get to the pitch of the ball and tap it to long-on
good length ball, spinning across the batsman from leg stump, he stays back and tucks it to short fine leg
slanted across the batsman from round the wicket, but ends up too full and he slaps it down to long-off
full ball on the stumps, defended with a straight bat

outside edge goes past first slip lucky for Hetmyer. He stayed back to that and tried to close the face of the bat, but the ball spun more than he expected. He was left with bat hanging, and the ball whizzed off the outside edge, but well clear of the slip
nicely played goes deep in his crease to this length ball on off, and cuts it with the turn. Great timing and it flies to the point boundary
goes across and down on one knee to sweep. Doesn't connect well, it takes the glove and goes to short fine

caught at long-off stepped down the track and gave himself some room. Got to the pitch of the ball and struck it well, but picked out the man at long-off perfectly. He had just been pushed back from mid-off. Brief but entertaining knock from Hetmyer ends
good length and turning sharply into the batsman. So sharply in fact that it ends up on his pads, and he flicks it to square leg
comes down the track - he's been doing that a lot to spinners - and taps it to long-on

just short went for the sweep, and the ball went off the back of the bat. Looped up and landed near the batsman. Backward short leg had a moment of hesitation before putting in the dive, but it just eluded him
goes well back in his crease to play it with the turn into midwicket
fuller ball, he comes forward and drives it nicely through cover
fuller on the stumps, and he connects with the sweep, but straight to square leg. Played the sweep almost standing up
lovely ball loops on the stumps, draws him forward, dips and turns past the bat. Nothing much the batsman can do about that
gets him forward again but this is a bit fuller and he manages to defend it.
full and on the stumps again, defended off the front foot
changes his line a tad to outside off, the batsman is drawn forward again, and the ball spins and takes a thickish outside edge. But soft hands, so it bounces well before reaching slip
nicely tossed up, he comes forward but doesn't get to the pitch. Ends up tapping it to mid-on
he's getting the batsman to come forward with his loop, but not quite reaching the pitch. Manages to defend it into the leg side
a touch full on the stumps, turned into the leg side
similar ball, he comes forward and turns it round the corner, but cant get past the man close in
tossed up outside off, he comes forward to push it to long-off
plays with soft hands to gully
waited and played it late, almost too late, eventually opened the face of the bat to run it down to third man
given some air, outside off. He went for the big drive but only inside-edged it to his toe

big appeal for lbw, given immediately and he reviews squared him up with the turn, it pitched on middle and leg and was spinning across him. Might be missing off, or umpire's call. Ultra Edge confirms no bat, so it's down to ball tracking. And it's hitting off stump flush - three reds. Taijul has his third. West Indies are sinking at a pace that will give the Titanic a complex
spinning sharply into the left-hander, who manages to jab it down towards leg gully
tossed up outside off, he comes down the track and gets to the pitch of the ball to stroke it through cover
down the track again, and patted to long-on
good length, spinning away, but he comes forward to defend it solidly
stays in his crease and cuts this to point
tossed up on off, pushed into cover off the front foot for a single
nice loop, drifting across the batsman and turning back into him. Maybe a touch too full, which allows him to dab it down into the leg side with relative ease
very full, and driven off the front foot but the bowler dives across his left to field
beats everyone drifted across the batsman, and turned back in through the gap. Went agonisingly close to off stump, and even beat Mushfiqur to go for four byes
drifted down leg, and he had moved across to flick it. Misses it but Mushfiqur, standing up to the stumps, can't block it either. Four more byes
a little fuller, drawing the drive, but it rolls off the inside edge to leg slip
better choice of shot, he goes with the sweep to the fuller ball, and gets it away past square leg
drifts down the pads, and is tucked to square leg for a single
down the track and beaten, by the turn, but it hits his pad and rolls forward. If it had sneaked through the bat-pad gap, a stumping was on
comes forward and clips it to long-on
beaten perfect spinner's ball, drawing him forward, and dipping and turning away. Turned a bit too much to take the edge of the bat though
down leg side and he sweeps, but straight to short fine leg
very full on the stumps, driven to cover
angling into the batsman from round the wicket. the aim must be to spin it across. too full though and he defends
full ball, blocked
changes the line to outside off, and draws the poke that connects with air, while the ball goes past the outside edge
flatter and quicker, on the stumps, defended
given some more air, and he stays in his crease to defend it
floated up outside off, and draws an airy drive without foot movement. no contact with ball
oooh, that squared him up with sharp turn. Drifted to pitch on middle and leg, and whizzed past. Perilously close to the outside edge
tossed up on the stumps, comes on the front foot to defend
went for the sweep, but only got an under-edge that rolls down leg and is collected by the keeper
driven with the full face of the bat to cover
takes a big stride out to smother the ball outside off
in the air but safe Wasn't in control of it, probably meant to chip it over the circle, but ended up hitting it too high. Still safe, landing beyond the reach of mid-on running back
comes forward and steers it down to third man off the front foot
full on the stumps, clipped to mid-on

bowled through the gate gets it to drift again, across the left-hander, which tempts him into the big drive. But the ball breaks inwards, and through the big gap to clip the stumps. It was a matter of time before this happened.
down the track to this flighted ball wide of off stump, gets nice and close to the pitch of it and extends his arms through a sweetly timed drive to find the cover boundary
flatter, pitches on leg stump and turns sharply down leg. Good take from Mushfiq
fuller now, and flat. Clipped firmly back to the bowler
a touch short on off stump, makes room and plays a delicate late dab to the right of slip
tossed up slow outside off, Roach drives to mid-off
flighted again, on off stump this time, Roach lofts it with lazy elegance, on the bounce to the left of long-on
full on middle and leg, defended inside-out into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra
flat length ball angling in towards middle stump and straightening. Defended back towards the bowler. A little more round-arm, this delivery
wow, that's square turn. Pitches outside off and beats Roach's attempted push by a couple of feet, easily

big appeal for lbw as this straightens on or just outside off stump as Roach presses forward to defend. Not given, and Bangladesh have reviewed... Came forward with bat and pad together and the ball didn't turn as much as expected. Actually, this may have straightened from middle stump rather than off as I initially assumed - looks close, this. Definitely pad first, and the bat jams into the pad. If ball-tracking is in his favour, this could be five for Taijul. It is. It's hitting middle stump three-fourths of the way up
in the blockhole on middle and off, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side off the back foot
length ball slanting across towards off stump. Doesn't quite get a proper stride out to defend, and the ball slides off the outside half of his bat, past third slip
length ball on middle and off, defended towards point. Didn't really get across to this
very full outside off, past the outside edge as Warrican pushes at it without accounting for the angle
length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, pokes at it and it runs away through the backward point region off the outside half of the bat
flighted ball on middle stump, clears his front leg and hoicks this over wide mid-on
flatter now, not as full, slanting into middle stump, blocked back to the bowler

tossed up once more, on off stump, and again he gets his front leg out of the way to heave over the leg side. Doesn't quite middle it on this occasion, and the man at a deepish straight midwicket can run to his right and stop it
length ball spinning away from off stump, goes back and across and blocks
flat and fairly full on off stump, shows the full face to block to mid-off
flat and short just outside off stump, Warrican loses his shape as he looks to pull this, too early through his shot and the ball sneaks under his bat
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, and Warrican punches forcefully at it. Thick edge, falls just short of the fielder at third slip

bam. Full on off stump and Warrican gives it a proper slog, creating swinging room by moving his front leg out of the way. Gets just enough bat on it for it to bounce a few times and roll to the long-on boundary
fullish on middle stump, shows the full face of the bat to play a checked drive to mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, lets it come on and nudges into the square leg region
lovely. Back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Gets back and across, waits, and opens his bat face to steer it past the diving third slip fielder
length ball pitching on off stump and continuing to angle away. Left alone

flighted and full on off stump, and Warrican is showing he likes it on that length. Nice, smooth swing of the bat through the line after getting his front leg out of the way, and he picks up four more to the long-on boundary
quicker, shorter, on off stump, goes back and blocks it back where it came from
flat again, but a little fuller. Gets forward and plays a checked push to short extra-cover
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of point
a little slower, floating up towards middle and leg, defended back to the bowler

excellent bowling. Having made him conscious of lbw with the middle-and-leg line, he shifts to a wider line outside off, with a bit of flight and dip. Doesn't get his front leg across to defend, and gets a thick edge that falls just short of second slip
full and flighty on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
a little slower now, and it drops slightly shorter, forcing Ambris to reach for the ball slightly as he drives down to long-off
back of a length, straightening away from off stump, goes back to whip it through midwicket
flighted ball on leg stump, defended back down the pitch
shortish outside off, stops on the pitch, denying Warrican the cut. Jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length, slides on with the angle towards off stump. Makes just enough room to squeeze a cut to backward point
full on middle and off, shows the full face for a push to long-off
back of a length on off stump, goes back and whips to deep midwicket
flat and full on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
full again, angled in from wider of the crease, defended back to the bowler
nice length, angling into off stump. Comes forward to defend, the ball rolls into the on side off the inside half of the bat
full on off stump, driven firmly to short extra
back of a length fairly wide outside off, left alone
slow length ball, closer to off stump, blocked off the front foot
back of a length again, fairly wide. Lets it come and plays a nice-looking late cut behind point
goes on the back foot to a length ball on middle stump, blocks it back to the bowler. Stayed leg-side of the ball there
short, a bit of width, cut away to the left of deep point
tossed up slow outside off, left alone
down the track and he floats it full and wide. Reaches out and stabs it away through the vacant backward point region
length ball outside off, slow, draws Ambris forward to use his wrists and play it down to short leg
back of a length now, turns in towards middle stump. Goes deep in his crease to work it to deep backward square leg
tossed up invitingly wide of off stump. Goes for the cover drive but the ball dips on him and forces him to drag it round to midwicket
flat, sharp offbreak turning in towards middle and leg. Stays back and works it through square leg
flat again, stays back to defend with the turn, into the leg side
ooh, beauty. Tosses it up, gets it to drift in towards off stump, and Warrican's front leg is nowhere near the ball as he looks to defend. Sharp turn beats his outside edge
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
slow length ball on middle and off, defended off the front foot
goes with the arm towards off stump, stays back to whip to long-on
length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
a touch shorter outside off, Ambris plays that late dab again to pick up a single into the third man region
floated up slow outside off, shuffles out of his crease nicely to drive to long-off
flighted ball outside off, uses a lot of wrist to whip to midwicket
floats it even wider and Warrican drives and finds the gap to the left of mid-off
flat, angling away from off stump, jumps across and shoulders arms, just lets it hit his back pad
flat and fairly full on middle and leg, jams his bat down in defence and squeezes it into the leg side
flighted and full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-on
flighted ball wide of off stump, sharp turn. Goes for the flat-bat cover drive and inside-edges it down into the pitch
shorter now, and Warrican can jump back to chop it into the point region and bring up the 50 partnership
a touch short again, cut away nicely behind point
tossed up, turns back in towards off stump. Stretches out and blocks into the covers
back of a length, turns in towards the pads, clipped to short leg
short, makes a bit of room and chops this through point. Met it in front of off stump, but the length allowed him time to go back and watch the ball all the way onto his bat
back of a length on off stump, goes back to defend into the point region
just a touch short outside off stump and Ambris rocks right back to pull it wide of mid-on
flat length ball on off stump, stays back to defend into the covers
length ball just outside off, nice stride forward to block into the point region
flighted ball on off stump, blocked to silly point
flatter, angling into middle and leg, not much turn. Gets forward to nurdle into the vacant midwicket region - bring that fielder in, Shakib!
back of a length, spinning in from off stump. Goes back to work it to the right of midwicket
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, uses his wrists to clip it to long-on
flat length ball slanting across to off stump. Stays back to push into the covers

ooh, mishit, and that's a superb catch from Shakib at midwicket! A bit of flight on middle stump, but Warrican doesn't quite judge the length. Dips shorter than expected as he stretches out to whip it into the leg side. Bottom hand comes off the handle, and the top-edge balloons over the infield, and Shakib, turning around and running towards the boundary, judges the ball's descent perfectly. Mehidy has ended this stand at 63, and Bangladesh only need one wicket now
flat length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, drives it nicely between the non-striker and the stumps at the other end. Could have run two, but chooses not to, unsurprisingly
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region

got him, has he? Yes, says Richard Illingworth, and Sunil Ambris gestures immediately for a review - but West Indies have none left! Taijul has six, and Bangladesh have gone 1-0 up in the series. Flat, on a good length outside off, and sharp turn and bounce - we haven't seen that in a while. Stretches out to defend, and has that brushed his glove through to the keeper? It hasn't, according to Ultra Edge, but there's nothing Ambris can do about that
